descript.abstract: This point dataset represents railroad stations in the United States. Version 2004 of the Fixed-Guideway Transit Network is a network database of the nation's fixed-guideway transit systems. The data set covers systems in cities defined as FTA's universe of cities and includes heavy rail, light rail, monorail, cable car, inclined plane, and automated guideway.
descript.purpose: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attracc.attraccr: Attribute information was obtained from individual transit agencies through telephone conversations, GIS data, transit agency websites, transit agency maps and schedules, and other traveler information systems. Data include a SOURCE field that identifies the original source of the data.

dataqual.logic: This database contains fixed-guideway transit features for agencies identified by RITA/BTS for processing as of 5/1/04.
dataqual.complete: Data were processed for FTA's universe of cities based on the availability of source data from FTA, RITA/BTS, or local transit agencies. At this time, coverage is incomplete for the New York City area due to the lack of availability of local transit data.

horizpa.horizpar: Right-of-ways for fixed guideways were developed from GIS data provided by FTA, RITA/BTS and local transit agencies. In most cases, the source data are very accurate and complete. In rare cases where the lines were digitized, DOQQ's for the local area were used as a reference for heads-up digitizing. Station locations were verified using street maps, local DOQQ's and USGS DOQ's which were available via the internet from a variety of publicly available data clearinghouses. Data include a SOURCE field that identifies the original source of the data.

procstep.procdesc: Source data were compiled from a number of transit sources. The SOURCE field identifies the original source of the data. The source data were checked for duplicate arcs. Connectivity problems such as dangles were corrected. All stations were checked for existence and added when necessary. Nodes were added to the Network at Station locations to facilitate routing . Pseudo Nodes where arcs cross without a station are flagged Status = 9.

cntorgp.cntorg: University of Tennessee Center for Transportation Research (UTCTR)

procstep.procdesc: In order to meet Tufts University's metadata standards: >Changed name of file from "transit_sta" to "USARailStations04" >Changed citatition title from "Transit Fixed-Guideway Stations" to "Rail Stations USA 2011" >Changed access contraints from "None" to "Unrestricted Access Online" >Changed originators/publishers from "Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)" and "Federal Transit Administration (FTA)" to "United States. Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Office of Geographic Information Services" and "United States. Federal Transit Administration" >Changed publication place to reflect LCNH formatting >Added theme keyword "point" to added theme keyword thesaurus "FGDC" >Added ISO 19115 Topic Category keywords >Added LCSH theme keyword >Added GNS place keywords >Replaced Tufts as the distributor >Exported metadata
